content:
On the community Discord I've bemoaned the fact that crater didn't find the (numerous) large compile time or memory consumption regressions that latest LLVM upgrade produced. @Joshua Nelson speculated the problem might not have been noticed because crater ignores timeouts because there are too many, and that might be a historical decision that hasn't been revisited. Is this an accurate description?

If so, I'm interested in the community having access to information about crater timeouts. Manually triaging timeouts in our spare time isn't too far different from random stuff people do in the community (perhaps I'm mostly speaking for myself).
all the data crater collects is publicly available
Where can I pull it down in a machine-readable format?
the "downloads" link at the top of every crater report
Ah! I didn't know about that site, just crater.rust-lang.org
if you go to the page of an old experiment it's linked there, and it gets posted in PRs when results come in
I think this is exactly what I wanted. Just didn't know where to look. Thanks!
(Saethlin) Ben Kimock has marked this topic as resolved.
